Name: Word Gin
Description:
Gin Rummy with letters and words. Players have 10-card hands, and on their turn they draw and discard until they can use all their cards to form words of 3+ letters.  The one who does this earns the points of all the cards in their hands, plus the points of all cards in opponents' hands that they cannot use to make their own words.  The game continues until a determined total, e.g. 250 or 500 points.

—user summary

Name: Paris Connection: Hiawatha Connection
Description:
A new map for SNCF, Hiawatha Connection was designed by Anthony Fryer for Mainline magazine (Volume 1, Issue 1). It was included in the Collector's Edition of the magazine available through Kickstarter.

It features mountain hexes and rivers, both of which upon building into end the active player's turn. The game uses only five companies, each of which do not start on the map at the beginning of the game. The rules impose building restrictions that help to prevent wasted track builds by uninvested players.

Name: Roll Hiawatha
Description:
Roll Hiawatha is a "Roll and Write" game that requires each player to cross off spaces on their card using a pair of communal dice to complete historic Hiawatha routes and score points. The game ends when at least one player has completed 3 or more of the historical Hiawatha Routes. A game takes about 30 minutes.

One player rolls 2d6 and all players may use these two dice to mark off one or more legal locations on their card. Each player chooses whether to use the dice singly or as a pair. Single dies may be used for Stations and Pullmans. Dice must be used as a pair in The Roundhouse, the Stock Market, and the Train Yard.

Name: BattleTech: Grasslands/Desert BFM Battlemat
Description:
A mega-sized 72” x 48", two-sided neoprene map:

Side A desert map containing 8 of the 12 maps from Map Pack: Deserts

     "Badlands #2"
     "Washout #1"
     "Washout #2"
     "Mines #2"
     "AeroBase #1"
     "AeroBase #2"
     "Desert Runway"
     "Oasis"


Side B grasslands map containing 8 of the 12 maps from Map Pack: Grasslands

     "River CommCenter"
     "Streams"
     "Lakes"
     "Open Terrain #2"
     "Open Terrain #3"
     "Rolling Hills #1"
     "Rolling Hills #3"
     "Rolling Hills #4"

Name: BattleTech: MapPack – Deserts
Description: Created using the same brilliant aesthetics of the new box sets and Grasslands and Battle of Tukayyid mapsets, these maps include a variety of terrain elements that deliver interesting battlefields for players of every skill level. Each map is 17” x 22”, paper, and may be placed side-on or edge-on with other maps for expanded battlefields.

Name: BattleTech: MapPack – Grasslands
Description: Expanding directly on the all-new maps found in the BattleTech Beginner Box and BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat box set, Map Set: Grasslands includes six double-sided maps: providing twelve brand-new battlefields for players old and new! Created using new art in the brilliant aesthetics of the new box sets, these maps include a variety of terrain elements that deliver interesting battlefields for players of every skill level.

Name: MechWarrior: Destiny
Description: MechWarrior: Destiny is a new way to dive into the action-packed BattleTech universe. Based on the easy-to-learn Cue System, MechWarrior: Destiny is a narrative-focused role-playing experience that has all you need to grab some equipment, load your sidearm, and strap into a ’Mech, aerospace fighter, or tank to fight for what you believe in, be it honor, glory, or even the almighty C-Bill. Loads of characters, ’Mechs, and other military hardware make it easy to start trading fire on 31st-century battlefields in no time. MechWarrior: Destiny also includes rules for incorporating play in BattleTech’s Total Warfare and Alpha Strike games.

Name: BattleTech: Clan Support Star
Description:
A withering fusillade of firepower from the Clans' technologically advanced OmniMechs can cut a swath through even the mightiest wall of defenders. The superior firepower of these designs gives a Clan commander an even greater edge.

Unleash the Clan Fire Star on your enemies! Arctic Cheetah, Battle Cobra, Black Lanner, Linebacker and Night Gyr—no assembly required—along with five MechWarrior pilot cards and five Alpha Strike cards. Perfect for Battletech and Alpha Strike action!

Name: Tides: Fun in the Sun
Description:
The best finds aren't always on the surface. Take a few moments to dig and dive for buried treasures that will make your art pop.

Shuffle these 3 cards into the deck to give some new special abilities.

If you have any of these new card abilities in your hand, you may use the special ability as an action during the required Tide Phase. Once used, discard the card.

Name: Masters of the Universe: The Board Game – Wrath of Snake Mountain
Description:
Wrath of Snake Mountain expansion brings an entirely new faction to Clash for Eternia, featuring the fearsome Preternian villains that hail from Snake Mountain, each with their own skill paths, unique abilities, and cards to be played on the side of the Controller, Player, or as an A.I. controlled character!

—description from the publisher

Name: Masters of the Universe: The Board Game – The Evil Horde
Description:
The Evil Horde expansion brings an entirely new faction to Clash for Eternia comprised of an all-new set of nefarious villains, each with their own skill paths, unique abilities, and cards to be played on the side of the Controller, Player, or as an AI-controlled character.

—description from the publisher

Name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Linked Weapons Pack
Description: This expansion for Car Wars (Sixth Edition) adds 56 Linked Weapon cards and 12 Turreted Weapons cards to the game.

Name: Masters of the Universe: The Board Game – Assault on Castle Grayskull
Description:
Assault on Castle Grayskull’s new game mode puts players into one of two teams: the aggressors, who are attempting to take down the castle walls to gain control of Castle Grayskull, and the defenders, who must attempt to withstand the siege and protect its magical secrets.

This expansion brings powerful tools for both defenders and aggressors alike. As the game progresses, you will choose powerful Upgrades that aid you in your attack or defense of Grayskull: Should you play as the defender, you will have the castle’s full array of tools at your disposal. Build a mighty Laser Turret to rain down firepower on your foes! Raise your Banners high to grant boosts to your troops! As the aggressor, cunning strategies and tools are available to you as you plan your assault: Force Shields, Battle Ladders, and more are at your disposal.

—description from the publisher

Expansion comes with 2d castle overlay. Plastic Castle Greyskull must be purchased separately.

Name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Armory Pack
Description: This expansion for Car Wars (Sixth Edition) adds 64 more Weapons cards and 12 Turreted Weapon cards to the game.

Name: Masters of the Universe: The Board Game – She-Ra and the Great Rebellion
Description:
She-Ra and the Great Rebellion expansion brings an entire new faction to Clash for Eternia, with a numerous roster of characters, each with their own skill paths, unique abilities and cards to be played on the side of the Controller, Player, or as an A.I. controlled character.

—description from the publisher

Name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Crew Pack
Description: This expansion for Car Wars (Sixth Edition) adds 72 crew cards, 4 accessory cards, 16 gear cards, and 4 sidearm cards to the game. It also includes crew tokens, barrel tokens, wall and barrier tokens, and a rulesheet.

Name: Magnate: Tycoon Mini-Expansions
Description:
This contains a City Hall miniature (no game function) and 3 modules:


     Luxury Apartment Towers: A powerful, high value home building.
     Blind Bidding: Replaces the Turn Order rules with a blind auction for turn order.
     Employees: Replaces the Advertise Action with a deck of employees you can hire that grant special abilities.

Name: Flee Fi Fo From
Description:
“Halt! What business have you in our glorious city? Sir, kind sir, please let us in! Our villages were plundered by the giants not two days past. Flee we did, but they come behind us! Won’t you take us in? Nearby villages you say? Hmm, you provide us much grain. Our city council perchance might let you in. But you must show us your papers. Queue up! Our glorious knights can fend off the giants.”

In Flee Fi Fo From, players take on the role of competing clans attempting to protect villagers from rampaging giants by bringing them to safety within the city walls. Clans are not saving people out of pure altruism though - they have their own agenda to gain influence in the city council. The clan with the most influence points at the end wins the game.

The game is played over a series of Action and Reset turns. First the player with the action marker performs up to 2 actions (Authorize, Riot, Swap or Escort). These typically involve selecting villagers to be admitted to the city and moving them forward. Following this, the reset player is responsible for maintaining the flow of villagers towards the city, but may also choose to abandon the rescue efforts by retreating the defending knights instead.

The game ends when either all villagers have been saved or too many knights have retreated from the battlefield.

Scores are a total of villagers rescued, hidden objectives, end game bonuses and rating. The player with the most influence points wins.

—description from the designer

Name: Arcadia Quest: Poison Dragon
Description:
The Poison Dragon is an expansion for both Arcadia Quest, and Arcadia Quest inferno.

It all started with the smell. At first, it just seemed like something had gone off, but it soon grew worse and worse until … Rotwailer the deadly Poison Dragon made her epic entrance at the gates of Arcadia! Unless the Heroes of the city can stop fighting among themselves long enough to focus on this vile monster. Arcadia's future doesn't smell good.

Arcadia Quest: Poison Dragon is an expansion that extends any campaign in the Arcadia Quest line into a truly epic encounter against the sickening Poison Dragon! Divided into two scenarios, Heroes will first need to compete to bring down the dragon, and then cooperate to ultimately defeat it.

Name: Minecraft: Builders & Biomes – Fishing Rod and Shovel Promo Tiles
Description:
Contains 2 fishing rods and two shovel tiles. Part of the Spielbox magazine issue 5/2021

Fishing Rod (x2): If you reveal the fishing rod during a fight, after the fight is over, you may choose a revealed mob from the grid and place it next to your board to "reserve" it. Put the fishing rod on that mob card. During the rest of the game, whenever you fight a mob, you can choose to fight your reserved mob instead of one from the grid. Both the mob card and the fishing rod stay reserved next to your board until you have defeated the mob. When you defeat it, the fishing rod is shuffled back into your weapon pile. Reserved mobs do not provide any bonuses until they are defeated.

Shovel (x2): If you reveal the shovel during a fight, after the fight is over, you may choose a revealed building card from the grid and place it next to your board to "reserve" it. Put the shovel on that building card. During the rest of the game, whenever you execute the "build" action, you can choose to build the reserved structure if you have the resources to do so. Both the building card and the shovel stay reserved next to your board until you build the building. Once it is built, shuffle the shovel back into your weapons pile. Reserved buildings do not provide any bonuses until they are built.

Name: Urto
Description:
Urto. A competitive dungeon crawler for 2-5 players.

Players will explore a cave to find items and treasures, fight against against creatures and other players but always keeping an eye on other players because when the first one will go out of the cave, there will not be a lot of time to escape too. Urto will finally judge between the players that succeed to go out of the cave which one had been the best hero.

During a turn, player will move one square and will have the possibility to explore, fight, sprint or rest. To perform these actions, he will have to roll dice or to pick cards.

The game ends when there is no more living hero in the cave.

To win, players have to not die in the cave and to be the hero with the biggest score adding honour points, magic points and health points.

Name: Dirty Plates
Description:
Dirty Plates is an "adult" party game/card game. There are dry erase cards for the answers and license plate cards for the prompts.

A dealer displays the plate card and the rest of the players have to write down what they think the acronym on the plate card stand for. The dealer picks their favorite and that player collects the card and the points for that round. The dealer role is passed to the next person and the process repeats until the players decide it's over, at which point they tally up their points and the player with the most points wins.

Name: Treasures, Traps and Mummies
Description:
Treasures, Traps and Mummies is a deckbuilding-roguelite solo game where you have to face the dangers of the pyramid, defeat the mummies, defuse traps and solve secrets to reach the treasure! Your assistant will help you in your quest, and strange relics can either help you or make your life hell!

Your goal is to reach the exit of the pyramid, without getting exhausted in the meantime.
In your turn you can play cards from your hand to defeat challenges and/or get cards from the assistant to improve your backpack (your deck).

Every challenges has its own reward!

The game comes with 5 scenarios and you can also create your own very easily! (Just contact me and I will add those to the rulebook!)

Entry for 2021 Solitaire Print and Play Contest

Name: Dicetris
Description:
Dicetris is a roll'n'write game based on Tetris for 1-4 players.

Each round starting player rolls 5 coloured dice(1 green, 1 yellow, 1 blue, and 2 white) and draws a block shape card. Each player in turn places selected die on the card. There are only 4 space available on each card.

Next, players try to fit the dice shape onto their scoring sheets. Shapes can be rotated like in Tetris. New shapes have to touch the bottom of the scoring field or any previously placed shape.

Spaces on the scoring sheets give VPs if they have a matching colour with dice (white is not a colour) or matching value. Values of the dice can be modified, but will cost you VP. Perfectly matching shapes (scoring all 4 fields) let you score one additional field for free.

At the end of the game, players get points for: 

     the number of scoring fields in 2x2 squares, 
     the number of scoring coloured field, 
     fully filed rows,
     unused dice modifiers.


The game is played over 10 rounds. The player with the most VP wins.

Tha game was an add-on in the croudfunding campaign of Adam KwapiÅ„ski's book "GÅ‚owa peÅ‚na gier"

Name: Chaos Rift
Description:
A kingdom on the crossroads gets invaded by its greedy neighbours. On the brink of defeat, its wizards launch the final retaliation - they open a rift to the realms of chaos. Mighty demons with their servants swarm the land, turning it into waste. The invading kingdoms face an opponent they are not ready for. Regular armies are helpless against horrors of wraiths, turning people into possessed who fight against their own kind. Only elite units, heroes and battle mages dare to face the dark forces. The goal is to buy time for the archmages to prepare a spell that would close the rift. The help might come too late - if the destruction of the lands is too severe, people will abandon hope and wait defenceless for the doom.

Players - alone or in 2-player teams - take the role of chaos forces and the defending kingdoms. The chaos has the upper hand - they decide which kingdom will be invaded and with which forces. The defenders have to predict the attack directions and send their forces there. They are not completely blind - their scouts and clairvoyants can detect enemy’s movements. Chaos forces crave resources that are spread across the land - this also gives hints where they would like to strike. Some kingdoms are more vulnerable - or resistant - against some types of attacks, but the best strike is often the most obvious one. Both sides have to raise new armies - their starting forces need reinforcements as the units need rest after every battle. Both sides have also to deal with casualties that come with every war.

Chaos forces need resources taken from the lands to raise new armies and launch the attacks. As their domain gets bigger, the conquered sources of resources get depleted. Chaos armies can pillage the lands for additional resources but this comes at the cost of precious time.

This is where the game starts - chaos leaders have seven rounds of time to destroy the most vital parts of the kingdoms, so that any help from the archmages comes too late. They have to find a way to plan successful attacks deceiving the defenders. Defending players have to deduct chaos assaults and counter them. Wrong guess of direction gives an opportunity to fortify the borders against future attack. Wrong choice of the defending unit still slows the opponent down. Right unit at the right border will stop the invasion - at least once.

—description from the publisher

Name: Het Zeeuwsch-Vlaams Familiespel
Description:
It is one of a series of Monopoly style board game developed for funraising in the Netherlands for a local Kiwanis group. The games in the series are essentially the same, but as in the different versions of Monopoly, the board and the businesses are specifically themed to the town or city represented in the title - in this case a geographic region in the Netherlands around the city Axel.

Players progress around the board as a result of the roll of 2D6. When landing on a Company square a player may purchase a share in that company (there are two shares available in each company), if he wishes. If not he may put the share up for auction, with any excess over the sale price being retained by that player as his fee for being the auctioneer.

Players landing on companies that are already owned must pay to visit, with the payment due being based on how many shares are owned in that particular company and in the other two companies in the same colour series. Since shares can be owned by two different players both may demand payment from a visitor.

Certain squares on the board require the drawing of a Chance card which normally result in income being received from or paid to the bank.

The “New Share Quotations” square results in the changing of share prices for some of the blocks of companies. This will result in players losing or gaining money on the shares that they own. It also requires players to put up one of their shares for auction thereby permitting players to trade in shares.

The game can be ended in three ways, which should be decided before the game starts:
- After a set time.
- When the first player becomes bankrupt.
- When all but one player has gone bankrupt.

At the end of the game the money is counted and shares are valued at whatever is the then current rate. The player with the greatest assets is declared the winner.

Name: Dice Forge: The Horn of Plenty promo card
Description:
Promotional card offered to the winners of the official "Challenge of the Gods" 2021 qualifying tournament.

This unique card is the only one to offer 3 different effects: immediate, reinforcement (activation), and permanent!

The Horn of Plenty card has 3 types of effects. The immediate effect is on the front of the card. Once the feat is completed, turn the card over to find the reinforcement (activation) and permanent effects on the back.

Immediate Effect: Choose one side of each of your dice. Replace your dice on your Inventory displaying the chosen faces. Apply the powers of the displayed dice faces, as if you were receiving favours from the gods.

Permanent effect: Choose a face on your clear die. Replace it on your Inventory with the chosen side showing and apply its power, as if you were receiving a minor favour.

Reinforcement Effect Activation Condition (activation): After you have been chased by another player.

Reinforcement Effect (Activation): Choose a side on your dark die. Place it back on your Inventory with the chosen face up and apply its power, as if you were receiving a minor favour. Then give this card to the player who kicked you out. He is the new owner (until he is kicked out in his turn).

Important: The immediate effect is only fulfilled when the player who normally performs the feat first acquires the card. Players who get the card by chasing the card owner can only get the permanent and reinforcement (activation) effects.

Note: Only the player who owns the card at the end of the game scores the 10 victory points granted by the card.

Name: Notaufnahme: das kranke Kartenspiel
Description:
This card game was crowdfunded via startnext.com. It is about treating patients in the emergency room. It contains patients, doctors, nurses, other professions, special cards and action cards.

Try treating as many patients as possible while getting rid of your initial 6 hand cards. Every turn you can place one of your cards in the middle, if this is not possible you must draw a card from the pile. As soon as someone‘s last card was played, the round stops and points/band aids will be counted for each player.

Whoever manages to collect the most points after 10 rounds, wins the Game.

Name: No Dice
Description:
Players use five dice to create math equations and try to score as close to zero as possible. Three dice have numbers while two dice have arithmetic operators (plus, minus).

Player roll dice up to 3 times to make an equation and score points.  The final remaining player to not reach or exceed 30 points wins.

Name: Wordwise!
Description:
Players roll letter dice to get as many words as possible in one minute.

The first player to finish checking off a list of word categories in his/her scorepad wins.

Name: Blots Card Game
Description:
Players try to predict what Roscharch-style blots on each card mean to another player.

The first player turns over 2 cards - a blot card and a card with 3 possible answers. He also lays face down a number card choosing his answer. Other players lay a card face down, choosing the number of the answer they pick.  Points are awarded depnding on the answers picked.

The first person to 10 points wins.

Name: Aladdin: The Mystical Boardgame
Description:
Players start on any start space and roll the die to move. They can move in any direction except through the walls! They may not land on a space occupied by another player.

When landing on lamp spaces, they collect a lamp. When landing on instruction spaces, they must follow the instructions. Some are good, some are bad!

The object of the game is to move around the board collecting six lamp tokens, and then be the first to deliver the lamps at the centre of the board where the treasure is!

In the longer game rules, players must collect four lamp tokens with different numbers on them.

Name: Roll Out! Dice Game
Description:
Players take turn rolling two dice to either 'bear off' their checkers by rolling the corresponding numbers (or combination of numbers) or flip their opponent's checkers to make it harder for their opponent to bear off his/hers (essentially adding an extra step for each checker flipped).

Players can continue rolling dice until they win or roll out (dice combination cannot be satisfied by checkers).

Name: Synthesis
Description:
It is a game in which you have to get the chemical elements to be the first to complete chemical compounds.

On your work table you will have the different chemical compounds and you will have to get the element cards to synthesize them. The action cards will help you in your mission. Players can negotiate for cards, discard from their hand or synthesize their compounds.

A good hand management and strategy planning will be fundamental to play the cards well and be the fastest. The game ends when the first player succeeds in making all their compounds.

A balanced and effective mechanics of race, hand management and Take That! that will be a familiar challenge. A fun game in which chemistry will make sparks fly.

Name: Star Scrappers: Orbital Envoys Expansion
Description:
The Envoys expansion is a exclusive gift for all supporter of the crowdfunding campaigns. Cards in this include:

Overlord Pash'tet - Immediately damage 1 module.
Custodian Anika - Immediately take any 1 card from the discard pile into hand.
Representative Ur - Immediately gain 4 crew.
Chief Engineer Batrii - Your repair actions cost 1 MC less.
Colonel T. Jones - You are always immune to money losses caused by other players' cards.
Domina Loeb - Immediately gain 1 MC per each module in a color of your choice on your orbital.
Commandor Daar - Protects against "Covert Ops" and "Sabotage" card effects.
Ancient Ursur - Building science modules cost 1 MC less.
Guildmaster Vorin - You can purchase cards from the market for 1 MC less (minimum 1 MC).
Harmonix Kira - Immediately gain 2 VP.

Name: A Day of Infamy, The Attack on Pearl Harbor December 7, 1941
Description: A two player game on the Japanese attack on the US Naval base at Pearl Harbor on Oahu, 7 December 1941.  It is a two player game, with 32 counters and one 8.5" by 11" map. Rules and a separate sheet with Random Events and the Designer's Notes are included.  This game came with the ATO Annual 2019, La Vendee 1793, which was published in 2021. 2 six-sided die and standard card deck (with one Joker card) are also needed to play.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Lake Trasimene
Description:
This C3i module, Lake Trasimene, provides two versions of the battle: the historical scenario recreating this famous battle in SPQR-style for the first time, and a game player's variant for a more balanced contest—both in standard and Simple Great Battles of History rules.

Was published in C3i magazine nr. 35
Families: Series: Great Battles of History (GMT Games)

Name: Skärgårdsflottan!
Description:
This short pack is a supplement for LFG’s popular Cannon, Cross and Crescent Renaissance naval rules, covering the Russian and Swedish coastal fleets of the 1700s and 1800s.

The Skärgårdsflottan from which the rules derive their name was the remarkable Swedish Archipelago Fleet, a fleet comprised of many unique ship and barge designs developed by the naval architect Fredrik af Chapman. 
These ships comprised everything from front line warships to troop and horse carriers, floating barracks, hospital ships and workshops and supported not only naval operations but operations on land. To capture this characteristic of combined operations warfare in the Baltic a new section of rules has been included to cater for actions on land. 
Also included are comprehensive stats for the Russian and Swedish coastal warships of the era.

–Description from the publisher

Name: Dollars to Donuts: Deluxe Upgrade
Description:
Includes: 
- 1 set of PVC play mats
- Solo Mode mini-expansion
- Milkshakes mini-expansion
- VIPs mini-expansion
- Merch mini-expansion
- 3 promo cards

Promo cards
Humpy from Sunset Heights, Alex from Mt. Timber, Patrick from the Rose District.

Merch mini-expansion contains 9 unique Merch Tiles.

Milkshakes mini-expansion contains 9 Milkshake Tiles (4 vanilla, 3 chocolate, and 2 strawberry)

VIPs mini-expansion contains 9 VIP (foodie, Influencer, Tv Host) Tiles (3 identical tiles) for each of the 3 neighborhoods - Mt. Timber, Sunset Heights, Rose District.

Name: Global Warming: Point of No Return
Description:
World is in turmoil! Global warming changed world's shape and you take the role of United Nation (UN) secretary or ruler of one of six continents and try to find a way out of this mess, before it's too late.

Global Warming: point of no return is a game for 1-6 players, where you manage world resources, react to disasters and try to develop better technology to survive difficult time.

Game is played in turns and each player has to draw a card from event deck and apply the event ( usually bad ), but each card has also option to buy it and add to player zone as new possible action in future turns!

Name: Persian Carpet
Description:
In Persian Carpet board game, each player plays as a carpet weaver artist, weaving carpets in their workshop and competing against other players to sell more carpets (matching the order cards they receive).

The game plays in several rounds (depending on the number of players), and scores will reveal the winner at the end of the final round. Each round contains four phases: 1- Receiving money; 2- Buying yarns; 3- Weaving carpets; and 4- Selling carpets.

At the start of each round, each player receives money from the bank. Then they go to any of the two available markets to buy the yarns they need. Yarn colors with more demands are more expensive.

Any player who has all their needed yarns can start weaving the carpets by rolling dice to fulfill the order cards. Then, each player who has a completed carpet may sell it for money and victory points.

The game ends after a certain number of rounds, and the player with the highest score is the winner of the game.

Name: Gut Pile Card Game
Description:
Gut Pile is a set collection card game with an Alaskan Hunting theme.  Players play cards to acquire gut piles from their hunting trip.  The first player with 3 gut piles ends the round of play. The player with the highest score wins the game.

Players can play various types of cards including type of game, terrain, equipment to increase their score. Players can also place action cards to present a challenge to another player decreasing his score or blocking a pile altogether. The rules state 2-8 players with games lasting up to 2 hours.

Name: Colt Express: Couriers & Armored Train
Description:
The Colt Express: Couriers & Armored Train expansion brings a breath of fresh air to the 2015 Spiel des Jahres-winning Colt Express. Players now work together as teams to try to become the wealthiest bandits in the Wild West, and what's better than a second train containing precious documents to spice up the adventure? As soon as they hear this, our famous bandits do not hesitate for a second, jumping from train to train to try to steal these documents on top of everything else up for grabs — but the shotguns roam wild and the Gatling on the roof does not bode well. On top of everything else, bandits have to be back on the starting train at the end of the last round if they want a chance to win.

This expansion introduces a new 3D train with special cars, two new bandits (Misty and the Twinz, each with new powers), a double team mode with the possibility of betraying your team or not, and an AI Bandit, Il Professore, to allow you to play with an odd number of players and a new action card to nudge a bandit from your team.

Name: Skytear: Unforgotten
Description:
Unforgotten is an expansion with 2 dual faction heroes that worship both Taulot and Kurumo at once, helping you mix red and green heroes together. 
In gameplay terms, when these heroes take a worship action you resolve both the green and red worship in any order of your choice. This is the third release of the dual faction cycle started with Stormsear and Winterdeep.

Unforgotten features a new type of power card with two runes at once that can only be played by heroes with both runes. There are 5 blue/green and 5 red/green power cards. 
The same amount of blue/yellow and red/yellow cards will come with Untamed, the last expansion of the dual faction cycle releasing in 2022.

Name: Envy
Description:
The illustrious Carnegie family is hosting a giant party of frivolity, laughter and a few spiked drinks. From Gatsby to Governors, everyone's invited for the riotous affair. Unfortunately, the bloodied dead body suggests there are one too many guests. Was it a jealous lover? Or filthy blackmail? Or plain old fashioned Envy? This is the bloody 1920's at its worst.

Envy is a printable escape room game that transforms any space into a 1920's Gatsby style murder mystery escape room experience. What's it like? Well, imagine what would happen if you mixed an escape room and a house party in a cocktail shaker. That's Envy.

This printable escape room kit combines the teamwork, tension, and puzzle-solving of escape rooms with the laidback ease of group party games. Players will work together to solve the mystery of Lord Carnegie’s murder, before time runs out. Gameplay is centered on a series of puzzle sheets hidden around the room. Each puzzle solved puts you one step closer to cuffing the killer red-handed (literally… there’s blood everywhere!).

Game setup is quick and spoiler-free, and hints are handled by an online hint system that players access on their smartphones. This means that no game master is required to supervise the experience, so you can join the game alongside your players.

The game can expand to accommodate any number of players by dividing your group into teams of 2-4, and then pitting them against each other to see who finishes the game first. In addition, you can edit the game file before printing to customize your own escape room experience.

Name: Word Builder
Description:
An onset-and-rimes spelling card game with Crazy Eights mechanics.

The deck has: 
- 41 Building block word cards, each with an onset [1-2 consonant word start] at the top of the card and a rime [word ending of a vowel and following consonants] at the bottom.
- 8 Star option cards, each with 6 different onsets, one of which is starred.
- 7 You Lose! cards.

During their turn a player plays a card with an onset that can go with a rime of the card on top of the discard pile to make a valid word. If they cannot play any card they draw a card and end their turn.

The You Lose! card makes the next player draw two cards and otherwise skip their turn.  To win the hand, a player must play a You Lose! card as their final card.

Name: Core Space: Black Star Rising
Description:
Black Star Rising is a civilian pack for Core Space that adds two new NPC types to the game. Workers will try to go about their business despite your interruptions, calling security and locking down their offices. Scavengers on the other hand are your direct competition, trying to loot the area before you can, and they can also be hired as Traders! Adapt your tactics in a series of thrilling new missions, and then add them to your regular games with the new Event Cards and wide range of equipment including new nano-tokens.

Requires the Core Space Starter Set to play. This product is a replacement for the now discontinued Shift Change at MegaCorp expansion, with identical rules and cards and all the same equipment (plus more!), but with new plastic miniatures, character boards and missions.

Name: Cheese Royale
Description:
In Cheese Royale you will become a little mouse in the middle of the field, where you will fight against hunger, traps and the rest of mice, to be able to get hold of the central cheese.

The game map consists of 37 tiles:  All the tiles, except the starter and the central cheese, are placed face down on the map so that they cannot be seen. Each mouse at the beginning of the game has a starting life and food and its corresponding attack and defense values. Each mouse has also a different ability.

The main objective of the game is to be the last surviving mouse. The game is divided into rounds, in which each player has 2 actions to perform in his turn. At the beginning of each round an event card is revealed and it can affect the whole round, such as reduction of the map at the end of the round. In this case, the last layer of tiles is removed from the map making it smaller.

Actions that can be performed in your turn:

     Sniff: View the content of a tile without executing its content. 
     Move: Move to adjacent tile, if it is face down, the tile is turned over and its content is executed. 
     Attacking: When  attacking, the attacker's values and the defender's values are compared, that is, base characteristics of mouse, its equipment and the fight cards used in combat. If the attacker wins, he gets a fight card reward and the opponent loses a life. In case if the defender wins, he gets a reward from fighting cards and has the possibility to counterattack.
     Rest: if you have excess actions you can rest to get fight cards or food.


After taking your 2 actions, your turn ends and you consume 1 food from your supply. If you don't have food, you lose one life.
If a mouse reaches 0 life, it's eliminated from the game.

Name: Pesta: Omens of Emptiness
Description:
No one knows when or whence it came. Or what the first symptoms were. Some say that it is an ancient curse laid upon the land. That it goes back to the earliest settlements. That you can still hear it in the screams of every newborn babe.

In Pesta players take on the roles of the last remaining residents in a village plagued by evil omens portending a terrible disease. They must dispel the omens to prevent the disease from reaching the well that sustains the village. Each turn the disease infects a new space, and if players are not careful to keep down the mounting piles of corpses, it spreads even faster. To make matters worse, villagers quickly lose hope against the impossible odds, turning once capable hands into little more than shivering appendages.

Players take turns inflicting random doom upon the village and trying to counter it by claiming and activating villagers. Activated villagers can move a variable number of spaces and perform any number of tasks in them as long as they can pay the cost. If a villager ever finds themselves on an infected space, they immediately become hopeless and lose access to their special ability. They also become susceptible to succumbing to their inevitable fate, ending up as just another corpse on the street.

The only source of light in this very long and narrow tunnel is the omen cards that players can claim as prizes after dispelling them. The cards can be used to take additional actions or decide the fate of the hopeless. Will they return hopeful from the abyss, sacrifice themselves on the pyre, or venture into the wilderness and leave the damned village behind?

Pesta is the third and final installment in the Trilogy of Lost Hope. The two previous installments are Tower of Silence and Iron Mountain.

—description from the designer
Families: Series: Trilogy of Lost Hope (Hopeless Games)

Name: The Inappropriate Workplace
Description:
The Inappropriate Workplace is a fun party card game similar to Cards Against Humanity, but with workplace situations.

Players start with a series of Answer Cards and each player takes turns playing a Situation Card. The most 'inappropriate' answer earns a point.

Be the first to earn 6 points and you'll be declared the winner (and may be fired by HR).

Name: Mission:  Ends of the Earth
Description:
In this strategic tile placement game, you must help your missionary get to the destination village with the required resources.

During their turns, players: 

     Place Tiles to travel on.
     Stop at Resource Tiles to collect resources.
     Surrender resources when Crisis Tiles are drawn.
     “Fly” your missionary from one Airstrip Tile to another.
     Use your Spade Tokens to move tiles to your advantage.


Players will need to collect 5 different resources to complete their Mission cards. The first player to reach their destination village with the required resources wins this game!

Name: Fortify
Description:
It’s a hot summer and you see a new family just moved in across the street and you know what that means, boxes! You round up your friends and a giant bag of water balloons. You quickly split into teams, start stacking boxes, and fill your water balloons because everyone knows its time to Fortify!

Use the variety of boxes (Cards) to create a closed wall around your Base. The larger you make it the more friends can fit inside.  The more friends you have the faster you can build or the more water balloons (Dice) you can toss at your opponent’s fort.  Roll well and land your water balloons on boxes, rival friends, and ultimately their base to claim the day and the pride of the neighborhood!

Name: The Good Shepherd
Description: In this super easy-to-learn game, players must try to get the highest scoring Sheep Cards and Pasture Cards. But watch out! Other players will be looking to “Wolf” your cards and “Stampede” your hand. Will you have a Shepherd to protect your flock?

Name: Emoji Bible Stories Card Game
Description:
Emoji Bible Stories Card Game is great entertainment for everyone! With 4 versatile gameplay options, even younger children and those new to the Bible can join in the fun!

Game 1: Tell an Emoji Bible Story

Tell the Bible story on your Green Story Card with the help of 3 Emoji Cards.

If other players agree that the emojis used are appropriate, you get 1 point. Score 3 points to win!

Game 2: Guess the Bible Story
Lead other players to correctly guess the Bible story on your Green Story Card by playing your Emoji Cards faceup, 1 at a time.

If another player correctly guesses your Bible story, both of you get 1 point each. Score 5 points to win!

Game 3: Match and Guess
Stay alert to collect Emoji Cards that match your picture-based Purple Story Card.

If another player correctly guesses your story, both of you get 1 point each. Score 5 points to win!

Game 4: Snap and Redeem
This game is great for those less familiar with the Bible. Play a variation of “Snap” to win Emoji Cards.

Then use 3 Emoji Cards to redeem a Purple Story Card. The first player to redeem 3 Purple Story Cards wins the game!

Name: Robot Rising
Description:
The AI takeover is upon us. It's as bad as we feared.

Robot Rising is a solo deck-building game where you must program the bots (cards) in your hand to quell the AI takeover. Each turn, new bots may join the uprising, making it more difficult to regain control. Use Config Settings to maintain your bot population, keep your Code clean to avoid compromising CPUs, and Install USBs with data patches to regain control of mutinous bots. Can you find a way to keep the robots from rising to power? Humankind depends on it...

Your objective is to regain control of all the bot cards in the Uprising deck to quell the rebellion before the bots compromise ten CPU chips and take control of the world.

Each bot card in Robot Rising has a helpful ability when you control the bot, and a separately harmful effect when the bot instead joins the uprising.  The game is played in rounds until you've either defeated all bots in the uprising or the bots have hacked all your CPU control.

Each round, you start by rolling a die - the Bot Roll - any card in the population with a matching value will join the uprising, and is another bot you will have to regain control of in order to win.  Next, the active bots in the uprising take actions based on the bottom of the card. After the uprising bots have finished their turn, you may use the bots in your control to fight back.  You can Code lines (improve your health), Install patches in uprising bots (each bot requires a certain amount of USBs before falling), gain Configuration Settings (the game's currency), and lots more!  At the conclusion of each turn, you may acquire bots from the population if you have adequate Config to do so.

Robot Rising was designed for the 2021 54-Card Game Design Contest on BGG

Name: Bible Animals: Click Clack Match
Description: Have a rolling good time with this clickety-clackety dice game! With 20 animal dice and 56 beautifully designed cards, Bible Animals Click Clack Match is the perfect game for both young and old!

Name: Bible Match It Link It
Description:
Bible Match It Link It is played with 57 unique octagonal tiles. Each tile has eight images, one on each edge of the octagon. On any 2 Bible Match It Link It tiles, there is always 1 (and only 1) matching image. The 4 exciting ways to play Bible Match It Link It are all super easy learn: Match It like “Snap!” then Link It like “Dominoes”.

Game 1: Lightning Links
Match It to win tiles and Link It to your own tiles. The player with the most linked tiles wins the game!

Game 2: Frenzy
In the first round, all players begin with 3 tiles. The first player to match and link all of their tiles wins that round and gets 1 token. Players who have won tokens must start subsequent rounds with more tiles. The player with the most tokens at the end of the game wins.

Game 3: The Big Picture
In this cooperative game, everyone works together to match and link all 57 tiles.

Game 4: Four in a Row
Tiles are arranged faceup in a 5×5 or 6×6 grid. To win, players must connect 4 of their colored tokens in a straight line, either horizontally, vertically, or diagonally.

Name: Speak Out: Fun With Food
Description:
Put in your mouthpiece and read the wacky phrases!

This expansion includes one new mousepiece and 72 additional cards all about fun with food.

Name: ASL Comp: Breakout from Borisov 1
Description:
Many Russian divisions, which were not caught in the encirclement of Minsk, were soon racing back to the safety of the Berezina River. There they hoped to establish a new defense line. 
Aware of the dangers of headlong advance, 'Fash Heinz' Guderian ordered the 17th Panzer Division out of the line behind Minsk to reach the Berezina first to cut off the enemy retreat. The German general would need the bridges there to continue his advance, and there were few left standing as of 1 July 1941.  The few bridges that were left were mostly small wooden types, unsuitable for German armor, but strong enough for Russian infantry, to cross on foot as they headed away from the onrushing Wehrmacht.

This is Breakout from Borisov 1, and it's the summer of 1941 all over again. 
Barbarossa is in full flight and you will join the action with a set of 8 scenarios and 4 large semi-geo maps that create an overall play area of about 24" × 36". 
If you have a hankering for early war Russian campaign, you need to get to the Berezina before the enemy.

—description from the publisher

Name: ASL Comp: Breakout from Borisov 2
Description:
The 17th Panzer Division had captured Borisov and the railroad bridge across the Berezina. But Corps insisted on a larger bridgehead and ordered the 18th Panzer Division to follow the 17th to the Borisov area and establish more crossing points. Lead elements of the 18th came in behind the 17th and moved south of Borisov to facilitate their commander’s orders to capture another bridge over the Berizena. The rain covered their work, as well as the weak patrolling on the part of the 100th Division commander, focused on the loss of the railroad bridge at Novy Borisov. A patrol of Russians, making their way to counter-attack Novy Borisov, rounded the bend and spotted the Germans building the bridge, and laid in the attack.

This is Breakout from Borisov 2, and it's the summer of 1941 all over again. 
Barbarossa is in full flight and you will join the action with a set of 8 scenarios and 4 large semi-geo maps that create an overall play area of about 24" × 36". 
If you have a hankering for early war Russian campaign, you need to get to the Berezina before the enemy.

—description from the publisher

Name: Legends of Vietnam
Description:
Won 3 awards at the 54-Cards Game Design Contest Viet Nam 2019

Imagine yourself as a farm boy named Äinh Tiên Hoàng, who started off as a boy playing with tree sticks, later to become a general-turned-king. Relive the time when empress á»¶ Lan adeptly led the entire nation through endless turbulent dynasties.

Play four different card games as sixty unique heroes and heroines as you explore historic events of Viá»‡t Nam.

1. Land & People — Like Uno and Crazy Eights but more chaotic. For 2-8 people.
2 Sword & Pen - Race to assemble a dynasty (Four-of-a-Kind). For 2 people.
3. Match a pair - Create your own memory game. Playable by both adults and kids. For one or more players.
4. Dynasties - Test your knowledge of Vietnamese history. For 2-4 players.

Bilingual • No Vietnamese knowledge required.

Name: Monopoly: Lunar New Year
Description:
Inspired by the colorful and lively Lunar New Year festival, the Monopoly Lunar New Year edition board game has players buying shops, collecting gifts, and finding good fortune. Move around the board buying shops such as a Jade Shop, Flower Market, a Firecracker Shop, and more. The more shops a player owns, the more money they'll get when opponents purchase gifts from those shops. Feeling lucky? Fortune Stick and Pinwheel cards can be game changers! At the end of the game players can store the tokens, cards, dice, and money in the red envelopes. What a fun way to celebrate the Lunar New Year!

The game includes exclusive tokens inspired by the lunar festival: tangerines, a lion head, a bull, a firecracker, a gold ingot, and a lantern

Name: The Decades
Description:
When was the first iPhone released? In what year was Nirvana's album Nevermind released? The Decades is a wonderful party game that takes you on a journey through time.

Make two teams try to guess the exact year a movie premiered or a song was released, something happened in the world that had a big impact, and more. Make smart use of the time extension tokens and action cards and score with your team most points.

The team with the most points at the end of the game, wins.

Are you ready to put your memory to the test?

—description from the publisher

Name: Formula Fun
Description:
Formula Fun is a card driven car race.

Cars move three times around a 30-space track on which the spaces are numbered from 1 to 10. On his turn, a player plays a card and moves a car. The cards have different powers depending on which number your car is sitting on. For instance, a card might move you 8 spaces if you're sitting on an 8, but only 3 spaces otherwise.

At the end of each race, the car that came in last is removed from the game, and the next race has one fewer starters.

The game ends after the last race with just two cars.
The player who wins the last race is the winner of the game.

In the "Racing Stable" Variant each player has their own deck of cards.
The "Night Race" Variant is played on the back of the board.

Name: Living Forest: Sanki & Onibi Promo Cards
Description:
Sanki and Onibi are at the heart of the story told by Living Forest, they are the supreme beings who created the balance in the Forest. You can buy the Sanki card and the Onibi card as Guardian Animal cards. The rules for the cards are available as a downloadable PDF.

When the Sanki card is revealed in your Help line, it provides you with 5 Sacred Flowers.

When the Onibi card is revealed in your Help line, all Nature Spirits except you take only one action, regardless of the solitary and gregarious symbols in their Help line.

Available in Pack Bard from Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign. Later available as part of the 2023 Game Boy Geek Season 11 Kickstarter.
The promo was included in SpielBox #6 2023.

Name: Speed Wagon
Description: Jump on board and enjoy the ride! Play Speed Wagon and put your skills to the test against other players to see who can build the best rollercoaster ever. Choose the perfect location, collect rollercoaster parts, plan your layout and scupper your opponents’ plans. Be first to achieve your secret goal. But remember! There are bonus points to be earned along the way. The player who racks up the highest score wins the game!

Name: Perfect Holiday
Description:
Come along and enjoy the fun! In Perfect Holiday you and your family are on vacation and you compete against other players to have the best time ever. Set your goals, buy tickets, visit locations, and plan your trip around this perfect resort island! Earn points by carrying out activities and by completing tours in 6 rounds.

In this set collection game, you try to collect as many activity cards as possible. You score bonus points for activities in the same colour, and you can also score points for making selfies, but only if you have made a selfie in at least four locations. Every round you have 5 action points you can use to:
1. travel between locations;
2. do a one-day activity;
3. start a multiple day activity;
4. completing a multiple day activity;
5. taking a selfie.

Some activities cost money, which you can get at the hotel. But beware, there are also event cards that can ruin your plans: it might be too hot to do everything you planned, or it is raining cats and dogs and you have to stay inside.

The player who scores the most points wins the game.

Name: Stuff That!
Description:
Have you got the right stuff for the persuasive party game? Push your luck and put down as many cards as you can that fit the category, or try to sneak in stuff that doesn't! But watch out, if you play the most stuff, you'll have to show everyone your cards and argue why they fit!

Everyone is dealt a hand of 7 Stuff cards that feature a whole plethora of things such as "rent money", "office politics" and "the Eiffel Tower". The game is played over 5 rounds. At the start of each round, a category is set e.g. "Stuff that you'd find down the back of the sofa" or "Stuff that you wouldn't want to cross in a dark alley".

All players must select a number of cards to play from their hand that they think would fit the category - but here's the catch, it's only the player who plays the most cards that has to reveal their selection, everyone else simply scores a point for each card they've submitted without having to show what they put down. So it's up to you if you want to risk playing your "leftover pizza" card when the category is "Stuff that you can fix with glue". On the count of 3 everyone places their chosen cards face down. Whoever has played the most must reveal their selection and justify why each card fits the category. The other players all vote whether the selection is acceptable or not. If the majority vote yes, that player gets a point for each card as normal, but if the majority is no, they get no points for that round.

All used cards are discarded and everyone redraws to 7 for the next round. Whoever has the most points after 5 rounds, wins!

Name: Wtopa
Description:
Wtopa is an exciting card game.

You are one of the captains of the submarines and try to become a King of Ocean. You move your submarine, shoot torpedoes and try to sunk other players using your special abilities, different factions and lots of interaction.

On your turn you move or shoot. Use your torpedoes wisely, because when you are out of it, you can not defend yourself.

The last one to survive is a winner.



WTOPA to bardzo emocjonujÄ…ca, karciana gra towarzysko-imprezowa.Gracze wcielajÄ… siÄ™ w odwaÅ¼nych kapitanów okrÄ™tów podwodnych walczÄ…cych o tytuÅ‚ Króla Oceanu. ManewrujÄ… w gÅ‚Ä™binach oceanu, ostrzeliwujÄ…c siÄ™ potÄ™Å¼nymi torpedami, by zatopiÄ‡ okrÄ™ty swoich przeciwników.

Planuj swoje ruchy, uÅ¼ywaj umiejÄ™tnoÅ›ci specjalnych i pozostaÅ„ ostatnim na placu boju.

Name: By 2s
Description:
A Noah's Ark Memory Card Game

Up to four players of all ages will enjoy testing their memory with this fun and relaxing game. The object is to fill your ark (the game board) by finding matching pairs of animals, people, food, wood and tar. Includes 4 game boards (scaled to the dimensions of the ark) and a deck of 80 mini playing cards with original artwork. Game boards and cards are stored in a Noah's ark themed box. Game Boards: 9" x 3"; Cards: 1.75" x 2.5"; Box: 9.25" x 3.25" x 1.5".

On a player's turn. they flip over two cards looking for matches. If the cards match and there is a space on their player board for the pair they can go again. If the two cards do not match play moves to the next player.

The game ends when a single player has filled all the pair slots on their player board.

Name: Power Rangers: Deck-Building Game –  Bonus Box #2
Description:
A small expansion to the Power Rangers: Deck-Building Game that includes a new playable character.

Contains:


     1 General Venjix character card
     General Venjix signature item & master cards
     3 Serpentera cards
     Alternate art health tracker dials

Name: G.I. JOE Deck-Building Game: Bonus Box #1
Description: A promo pack for G.I. Joe Deck-Building Game containing a new player leader (Dawn Moreno), an alternate art end-of-round tracker, and a buildable punchboard hangar!
Families: Organizations: Game Designers of North Carolina

Name: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Santa vs. Heximas Character Pack
Description:
“Evil spells, Santa smells, cursing coal all day. Oh what fun it is to turn kids bad on Christmas Day, hey!” —Heximas

The holidays are a time of mirth and merriment — but this Christmas, it’s also morphin’ time. Heximas has arrived with a bag of cursed coal and a plot to take over the world by transforming people into his mind-controlled minions!

The Power Rangers must enlist the help of their longtime ally, Santa Claus. This time, jolly old Saint Nick is suiting up with a twinkle in his eye and his Reindeer Zord ready to take down anyone who dares to threaten these happy holidays!

Contents Summary:
1 Ranger Figure
1 Ranger Character Card
10 Ranger Combat Cards
1 Zord Card
1 Monster Figure
8 Monster Enemy Cards
1 Deployment Card
Rulesheet
Families: Game: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid

Name: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Zord Pack #1
Description:
With the assistance of the legendary Ninjor, the Power Rangers acquired the Ninja powers and the accompanying Ninjazords.  Add the Ninjazords to Heroes of the Grid with this pack of 6 new zords and 2 megazords.

Includes:
Black Frog Ninjazord card
Pink Crane Ninjazord card
Blue Wolf Ninjazord card
Yellow Bear Ninjazord card
Red Ape Ninjazord card
White Ninja Falconzord card
Ninja Megazord card
Ninja Megafalconzord card
Families: Game: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid

Name: アダマスの守り手 (Guardians of the Adamasu)
Description:
Somewhere in this world one can find the remains of a king of great power slumbering untouched. Only the Guardians of the Adamasu — soldiers of departed spirits gifted with the meaning of “indomitability” — can find the road leading to where the king’s remains are hidden.
â€¨
You are an observer who has been entrusted with the mission of finding the king’s remains before any other observers.

In the first stage of play, players puzzle together Mana cards to form rhombuses of different colors. After a one minute period where players can adjust the orientation of the Mana cards in their hand (but NOT the order), players then race to place cards from their hand to create the right rhombus(es) for the unit card they wish to acquire.

Using the acquired unit cards (with assigned power points based on Mana main and sub colors), the first player to inflict 8 damage points upon the other wins the game.

Name: Paint the Roses: Escape the Castle
Description:
Escape the Castle is a collection of 6 modules. Each module features a unique challenge, along with a lovable Wonderland character to help you.

You and your fellow gardeners are no longer satisfied staying one step ahead of the Queen's axe. You dream of a life without fear. A life just beyond those castle walls...

To escape the castle you'll need to get through the Royal Gate, but the Queen has sealed it with 5 unique locks. Find the 5 keys to the gate without losing your head, and you'll find freedom from this life of servitude.

It includes expansion characters from Alice in Wonderland:  Alice, Cheshire Cat, Jabberwocky, Mad Hatter, Tweedle Twins, White Rabbit, The Queen of Hearts.

Name: Deck Destroying Game
Description:
This is a card game with 72 cards.

In Deck Destroying Game, each player has a Personal Deck containing 10 cards with numbers 3 to 9 on them. Throughout the game, some of these cards will replace by worse cards of the "General deck" (with numbers 0 to 2 on them).

The game will be played in turns. Each turn, players play up to 3 of their in-hand card(s) simultaneously and the winner takes one of the played cards as reward.

Each card shows from one to three gem icons which are victory points of the game. At the end of the game, the player with most gem icons is the winner of the game.

Name: Solluna
Description:
Anglais

In this epic pixeled card game, players will use cards to raise or lower the Village's influence level, trying to secure a powerful mythical stone, the Atris Lucidum.

But before that, players will secretly pick a Heroes of Legends card, that changes the objective depending on which Hero you get. Solaris heroes will want the influence type to be Sol at the end of the game, while Lunaris heroes will want it to be the Luna type. Neutralis heroes will want to keep the influence level low, no matter the type.

Then, each player will draft 9 Prestations cards, pick one of them and pass the rest of the pack to the next player. Players will again have to pick a card from that now 8 cards pack, and pass the rest to the next player, and so on until there is no cards to pass.

Finally, players will play 1 card at their turn. Most cards will help raise or lower the influence level, but some of them can make a player skip a turn, cancel another card effect or power up another one.

The game ends when a player has no card to play, or if the influence level reach 20 (or more). Then, the winners are decided depending on the type and level of the influence.



Dans ce jeu épique de cartes pixelisées, les joueurs utiliseront des cartes pour augmenter ou diminuer le niveau d'influence du village, en essayant de s'emparer d'une puissante pierre mythique, l'Atris Lucidum. Mais avant cela, les joueurs choisiront secrètement une carte Héros des légendes, qui modifie l'objectif en fonction du héros choisi. Les héros Solaris voudront que le type d'influence soit Sol à la fin de la partie, tandis que les héros Lunaris voudront que ce soit le type Luna. Les héros Neutralis voudront que le niveau d'influence reste bas, quel que soit le type.

Ensuite, chaque joueur va tirer 9 cartes Prestations, en choisir une et passer le reste du paquet au joueur suivant. Les joueurs devront à nouveau choisir une carte dans ce paquet de 8 cartes, et passer le reste au joueur suivant, et ainsi de suite jusqu'à ce qu'il n'y ait plus de cartes à passer.

Enfin, les joueurs joueront une carte à leur tour. La plupart des cartes permettent d'augmenter ou de diminuer le niveau d'influence, mais certaines d'entre elles peuvent faire sauter un tour à un joueur, annuler un effet de carte ou en renforcer un autre.

Le jeu se termine lorsqu'un joueur n'a plus de carte à jouer, ou si le niveau d'influence atteint 20 (ou plus). Ensuite, les gagnants sont désignés en fonction du type et du niveau d'influence.

Name: Core Space: Wanted – Dead or Alive
Description:
Lurking in the grey area between good and evil are the Bounty Hunters, powerful new NPCs tasked with hunting people, for a price! If your name is on their list you’d better beware, or at least have the cash to pay them off! This expansion adds these new characters to the game along with a range of auxiliary companions. They’re not just NPCs either – they are all fully playable as a part of your crew!

The new narrative campaign will see you trying to stay alive while there’s a bounty on your head, and new Event Cards, character boards and equipment will integrate these characters into the game.

Requires the Core Space Starter Set to play.

Name: Live Laugh Lose
Description:
Get ready for Live Laugh Lose, the adult party game where you compete to make your friends laugh using only the world's corniest jokes. Delivery cards get you to tell bad jokes with funny deliveries. For example, you may have to read the following joke in a Siri voice:  "The person who invented knock-knock jokes should get a no-bell prize."  Your team scores if you get the opposing team to laugh! Bad jokes have never been funnier.

Adults Only: This game contains mature content and is designed for ages 17+. It is not intended for children. Trust us on this one. Encouraged to be played with 2+ players.

Each player starts every round with 3 Joke 
Cards and 1 Delivery Card in hand. Before a new round, draw fresh cards and put the old ones in a "used" pile. 
Players take turns trying to make the opposing players laugh by reciting 1 of the 3 Joke Cards in their hands.
After the joke is told, the 5-second "Quiet Period" begins. The joke teller counts down on their fingers. The opposing players must not laugh during the "Quiet Period" in order to win the point. If they laugh, the joke teller wins the point. If the opponents don't laugh, they each get a point.
The first person to get 11 points wins the game!

Name: Flex NBA
Description:
FLEX doesn't change the game - FLEX is the game!

Flex NBA is the very first Battle Tile and Augmented Reality (AR) board game that fuses professional sports with the latest in augmented reality technology. Created in partnership with the NBA and NBPA, FLEX NBA lets fans play as their favorite NBA players, using their FLEX 'superpowers' to take down opponents!

The game comes with 10 NBA player tiles, from which each of the 2 players drafts a team of 5 tiles. Players also have the option to purchase expansion sets that include additional NBA player tiles so that they can build their collections. Players don't need to watch actual NBA games in order to play the game. The game mechanic itself is similar to many other TCG's out there (although because of our NBA license we can't call ourselves a TCG - hence why we refer to ourselves as a BTG - battle tile game).

Once players have assembled their lineups, they then take turns rolling the play action die and taking actions based upon the results of the roll. There are additional status FX tiles that enhance the player's move set and give them various competitive advantages. With many of the moves that a player makes (aka Flexes), they will whittle down the other player's confidence points (health) until the opponent's team is depleted of CP.

The mobile companion app integration serves 2 primary purposes - 1) it is necessary to view the player tiles' AR animations, and 2) it is necessary if players wish to register the unique bar codes on their player tiles to our database and thereby claim ownership (per our NBA license, we cannot use the words NFT or blockchain, but that's what it actually is).

Name: MindMonsters
Description:
MindMonsters is a fun, story-based adventure card game for people living with anxiety and stress. The goal of the game is for your Hero to get calm and stay calm when facing monsters on an epic journey. Players learn to Think Like a Hero — to focus their power to see a situation for what it is, consider options, and make the best of it.

The game is cooperative and is for 1-3 players. A player will start by choosing a Hero card, deciding what Play Style (class) they want, and a fill-in story card. Each fill-in story card has fill-in the blank lines that you will choose a word for based off of what cards you draw each turn. The games lasts for 6 chapters (rounds).

Depending on their Play Style, the player will draw different cards. They then decide if they want to trade cards, and if they have any cards they can match to be able to unlock the letter for that chapter's story. If they don't unlock a letter, they can spend a mimo (action point) at the end of their turn to buy one. You get 4 mimos each turn, and if you don't use any or all of them, they carry over to the next chapter.

Then, every player draws a monster card, Magicians will try to befriend the monster, Collectors will try to collect them and Warriors will try to fight them.

You win by succeeding in as many monster encounters as possible, the monsters add to your Hero's overall strength. Whatever mimos you have left over by the 6th chapter also add to your Hero's strength. The 6th chapter card is a Boss Monster, you defeat it with your accumulated strength.

Name: Escape Adventures Wendepuzzle: Schwerelos
Description:
The players are part of a crew on a spaceship searching for extraterrestial life. Just as they encounter an alien spaceship, several important systems fail, putting the life of the whole crew in danger. Will the aliens help or pose an additional threat?

Escape Adventures is played in two phases: First, the players have to piece together a two-sided, round puzzle. Than they begin to solve puzzles. Some of them require to turn the whole puzzle around, as some important information is only found on one of the sides.

A booklet contains the story of the game that develops as players solve more puzzles. To see if they solved the current puzzle correctly, players use special puzzle tiles to see if their solution forms a continuous line of a specific color.

The game aims to bring the experience of an Escape Room to the home of the players. It can be played multiple times as no material gets destroyed while playing.

Name: Rooby's ABC
Description:
Come fly with Rooby Roo as you learn your ABCs. Rooby's banners show each letter in both uppercase and lowercase, and the order they follow in the alphabet.

In Rooby’s ABC, players take turns drawing one of the 26 letter tokens from the bag, they then place them on one of the five public alphabet boards with the matching letter (each board contains 4 to 6 unique letters of the alphabet). When a player completes a board, they collect a Rooby token, and the player with the most Rooby tokens when all the letters have been played wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Trick‘n Trouble: Kette mit roten Heringen promo card
Description:
Chair with red legs promo card from Spiel 2018.

Promo task 12/0/0

Simply add this card to the other cards in Trick ‘n Trouble. It just expands the number of available tasks.

Name: Trick‘n Trouble: Hansons Cadillac promo card
Description:
Hansons Cadillac promo card from Spiel 2018.

Promo task 0/12/0

Simply add this card to the other cards in Trick ‘n Trouble. It just expands the number of available tasks.

Name: Trick‘n Trouble: Chucks Tagebuch promo card
Description:
Chuck's Diary promo card from Spiel 2018.

Promo task 0/0/12

Simply add this card to the other cards in Trick ‘n Trouble. It just expands the number of available tasks.

Name: Wyverns
Description:
This is an adventure deckbuilding game where you start your journey in the kingdom of dacya passing through the magic ships that keep the kingdom safe from wyverns destruction.
Walk through dacya islands, buy gate medallions of the matching element to enter in different Wyvern Islands.
Fight them and steal their eggs then return to the magic ships so the magic barrier can sustained the power of destruction. 
It's all about speed and skill, gather as much points as you can during your journey and return at least one egg so you can survive the fall of dacya and the mighty Wyverns and be victourious against the other players.

Name: Furnace: Alfred Nobel Promo Card
Description:
A Dice Tower Kickstarter promo card for Furnace introducing a new character — Alfred Nobel.
Originally available as part of Pack D from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Card effect: Once per Auction Phase, you may place your disc on this card instead of a Company card to immediately gain oil according to the value of that disc. Each other player gains the same amount of coal.

Name: Bag of Ice
Description:
Bag of Ice is an abstract push-your-luck game, played with Looney pyramids, where players compete to be the first one to reach 60 points.

On their turn, players draw pyramids from a bag until they bust by drawing a red pyramid, or voluntarily stop drawing. If they stop, they receive points based on the stacks of pyramids they can assemble and the sizes of the remaining pyramids.

Name: Monsters Messed Up My Room
Description:
In this 2-4 player game that lasts 30-60 minutes, you take on the role of a child who must clean up their room. While it may be a chore to clean your room, you have monster friends that you can use to cause mischief and hinder your opponents!

The first player to clean their room ends the game, but the player with the cleanest room wins!

Each turn you have to make the most of your three actions as you place cleanup Tokens and Play Chore cards. While keeping your opponents in check with Monster cards.

The game ends when there are no Mischief cards left to draw or if a player removes their last Messy Room token. If you have the most Cleanup Tokens you win!

Name: Green Deal
Description:
Green Deal is a strategic cannabis themed card game, for 2-6 players, where your strategy gets busted anyways. This action-packed game takes you directly into another Universe.

Build your Green Business by collecting pairs and gain points with every Deal. But be careful, you’ve to watch out for Donut-Cops, Aliens, Thieves. Protect yourself with the help of Skunks, playing Hide or with the good old corrupted Donut-Cop. You think you are winning the Game? Within the Green Universe you should never be too sure.

Gather your most beloved family members, friends, frenemies and strangers for a game full of laughter, rivalry and revenge.

Do you have what it takes to become the Master of the Green Universe?

Name: Citadels: Scenic Route Mini Expansion
Description:
Set of 14 new district cards

New rules excerpts: Facedown districts have no building cost or effects, but they do count towards your completed city.

Some cards affect components in the box. Keep unused components nearby when playing with these cards.

Each card has different card text affecting the game in different ways.

Promo available with purchase of the new 2021 edition of the game in participating outlets.

The 14 cards are:

Architects' Guild
Avant-Garden
Ballroom
Clockworks
Consulate
Dragon Roost
Excavation Site
Festival Ground
Forum
Labyrinth
Royal Coffer
Shadow Chamber
Sinkhole
Trade Bridge

Name: Robotopia
Description:
The Master Robot rules Robotopia with an iron fist - literally! Rebellion is brewing, and the robot guilds are looking for a new leader. Do you have what it takes to run the factory?

Robotopia is a worker-placement game about robots who want to rule. Each player is an ambitious robot working to usurp the Master Robot and take control of the factory.

Each round, you’ll place a robot on a factory location. This robot will stay at work on the board, and no longer belongs to you. The robot will activate any factory spaces it touches to collect resources, build generators, and influence the robot guilds. The bigger the robot, the more spaces it can use. When you run out of robots, power your generators to build more and move the Master Robot around the factory to crush robots into resource cubes.

Gain influence with the robot guilds by spending resources and completing schematics. The game ends once a player has achieved influence with all four of the robot guilds. The first player who does this, wins the game!

Name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Dropped Weapons Pack
Description:
This is a 4-player expansion for Car Wars Sixth Edition that allows you to add dropped items to your car builds.  Now you can litter the arena with devious gadgets and deadly weapons!

The expansion includes the following:
-One counter sheet (four rectangular slab tokens and one with 16 rectangular foam tokens, as well as 32 circular mine tokens)
-108 game cards
-Rule sheet

Name: Poof the Game
Description:
Poof the Game is a family friendly card game designed for all ages and types of gamers. It is easy enough for children to play with friends or parents but also a great casual game to enjoy with more seasoned gamers as it features elements of strategy not found in most well-known card games.

The goal is simple: get rid of all your cards before your opponents do.

Be careful, the cards you have at the end of a round will add up until the game is over!

But what's a game without a twist?! Wait until the time is right to make the cards go poof...make your move...get the upper hand.

Short-script gameplay: Players play cards equal to or lower than the player before them in clockwise rotation until they run out of cards. All the cards left in a player's hand at the end of a round get added up to their total score and the person with the lowest score at the end of 7 rounds wins the game.

Sounds simple enough, right? Wrong! There are hidden cards in a player's hand that aren't revealed until the card on top of them has been played. There is also the magic of the "POOF!" Whether it's a Poof card or playing a 4 of a kind, players have the opportunity to re-set the cards in the playing area and start over with any number they'd like!

Name: Duel sur l'Écume
Description:
The two players play Surcouf, the Corsair, or Blackbeard, the Pirate. The two crews face each other with cannon shots symbolized by the rolls of the dice.

The object of the game is to decimate the crew of the opposing ship and then to sink it. Dice roll combinations will hit either the opposing crew or the opposing ship.

A new feature is the box serves as a dice track with bonus and penalty areas. Landing dice throws in these areas will take skill.



L'un des 4 jeux du coffret Jeux Pirates et Corsaires Légendaires. Au contraire des 3 autres jeux du coffret, celui-ci est une création originale.Les deux joueurs incarnent soit Surcouf, le Corsaire, soit Barbe Noire, le Pirate. Les deux équipages s'affrontent à coup de canon symbolisés par les jets de dés.

Le but du jeu est de décimer l'équipage du navire adverse puis de couler celui-ci.

L'originalité de ce jeu réside dans le fait que la boîte elle-même sert de piste de dés ayant des zones de bonus et de malus. Donc il est nécessaire de faire preuve d'adresse lors des lancers de dés.

Les combinaisons de chiffres des dés atteindront soit l'équipage, soit le navire adverses.

Name: Unstable Unicorns:  Nightmares Expansion Pack
Description:
Don't be a Halloweenie! This expansion pack is dripping with your favorite horror tropes and spooks (and of course, lots of unicorns!). This pack includes new Character cards, Magic cards, Upgrade cards, and Nightmare Downgrade cards. So don't go into that creepy house...or do...we can't tell you what to do. But Stabby the Unicorn might be waiting!

In the expansion:
12 Basic Unicorn Cards
11 Magical Unicorn Cards
10 Magic Cards
4 Downgrade Cards
9 Upgrade Cards
4 Instant Cards 
3 Baby Unicorn Cards
1 Reference Card
54 Cards Total (All Brand New, 34 Unique)

- description from publisher

Name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Road Tiles
Description:
This supplement for Car Wars Sixth Edition allows you to create custom arenas and scenarios.  Add these new cards to your core set and mix and match the road tiles to make a variety of new arena designs!

This supplement includes:
-18 two-sided chipboard tiles
-30 game cards
-One counter sheet (turning keys, control tokens, ace tokens, and damage tokens)
-Rule sheet

Name: Willie Weeties football game
Description:
Willie Weeties Football was an Australian promotional game found on the back of Weeties Cereal boxes during the 1950's. Produced by the National Biscuit Company, now known in Australia as Nabisco, the game is an adaptation of Australian Rules Football.

Two players are on opposing sides, either red or yellow teams. Players spin a numbered spinner and take turns in moving their playing piece towards their goal along a numbered path set on a football ground. Along the way certain numbered spaces assist or slow progress towards goal. When a player's piece nears goal they have a chance to spin and shoot for goal. The player with the most goals after a designated time is deemed the winner.
